entry.title: Temptation is One Hell of a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,853Chapters: 29/?Kudos: 272

Summary: Bruce Wayne never expected to walk into a church again—let alone with his four-year-old son in his arms. But when a meeting with Clark Kent, a priest. It turns into more than polite conversation, Bruce finds himself disarmed by a man who shouldn’t have surprised him at all. Clark is broad-shouldered, and impossibly kind; a believer in things Bruce turned his back on the day of his parents’ funeral.Bruce is skeptical, Clark is steadfast. Their ideologies clash from the moment they sit across from one another: billionaire pragmatism versus the faith of a priest. But somewhere between coloring books at Clark’s desk and quiet invitations to community fairs, a dangerous warmth grows. Bruce doesn’t know how to name it, and Clark doesn’t dare.Because whatever is happening between them—it shouldn’t. Bruce pushes, searching for the language he can’t bring himself to say aloud, while Clark whispers what he shouldn’t confess at all: I can’t. A vow binds him to the Church, but his heart betrays him in every secret meeting, every glance held too long.It shouldn’t work. It can’t work. But it does. And as much Clark Kent prays, temptation seeps through.

entry.title: Be strong, saith my heart (I am a soldier)
entry.summary:
Author: Garfimini

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,282Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Clark (37) is overworked, underpaid and drinking too much coffee for an alien. Bruce (25) is younger, going through an emo crisis and still fiding time to save Gotham. Between staying alive, boring meetings, pretending to not know each other, they find themselves entangled in a relationship both thrilling and terrifying. It's incredible, fulfilling and Clark feels like he is 18 again while Bruce learns what is real intimacy. But what happens when they realize they don't expect the same thing from this arrangement ? Time to find out. Oh and they read the Odyssey.

entry.title: An Amethyst Engagement
entry.summary:
Author: TheBobblehat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 151,232Chapters: 30/?Kudos: 276

Summary: Sequel to A LILAC LOVE Bruce and Clark are officially engaged, and the Waynes are wasting no time planning for the big day. In the meantime, Damian returns to school, which gives Clark ample opportunity to begin integrating himself in Damian's life as his new father figure. That is, until they're paid a visit by Talia al Ghul, who intends to sway Damian back into the League of Assassins under the orders of his grandfather. Things are made even more complicated when a certain chain-smoking, cockney wizard shows up at the manor with terrible news. As it turns out, experimenting with Brainiac's aether without a failsafe can come with some unpredictable results.

entry.title: the soul selects her own society
entry.summary:
Author: familiarfantasy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,793Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 115

Summary: "Bruce Wayne? Gotham’s golden prince, her favorite son. The tabloids joked that everyone knew everything about Wayne, which was usually far too much. He wasn’t simply an open book, rather having the pages highlighted and annotated for anyone to peruse. The man’s favorite artist was Britney Spears. He went on frequent skiing trips to Aspen. He had Calvin Klein ads that covered billboards and sex tapes leaked from his college days. Clark didn’t tend to follow celebrity scandals, but the man’s life, ever since he reentered the public eye, seems to have been made for spectacle...The first two days, Clark was completely and utterly convinced the universe had made a mistake. He wasn’t meant to have a soulmate in the first place, and there wasn’t a chance his words were connected to Wayne of all people. All he could do was mourn the soulmate he was supposed to have, the one he had expected, the person he was destined to save not as Superman, but as Clark Kent." or, how Clark Kent discovered his soulmate was Bruce Wayne, then took it upon himself to figure out who the man truly was.

entry.title: Then He Kiss'd Me
entry.summary:
Author: Alwhisker

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,557Chapters: 10/20Kudos: 209

Summary: .... - "I didn’t need a glorified spandex ad to come to my aid" Wayne's tone was glowering and slightly breathless as he wiped the blood off his chin, looking over to the caped man who’d been covered in dust and rain, clark was taken aback, but remained his composure, it wasn't time to bicker with billionaires just yet. "you're welcome" he muttered, floating up to look over the crowd, he watched as the officers surrounded Bruce Wayne, EMT's checking over his wounds as the criminals were carted away into padded cars, flashing lights of cameras clicking around the scene. but clark could only focus on the man wiping his bleeding lip, effortlessly drawing him in, among the thousands of voices in his mind, only one stood out.only one."Alfred, I promise you I am fine, I- no, my leg’s fine, Grayson. Damian, stop."Clark found himself grinning, soft enough that he didn't notice it at first, but the clicks of cameras and flashing lights woke him up from his daydream, the wind under his chin was getting colder, Gotham's air was gentle on his skin, despite the smog in the air and the scent of blood that somehow always lingered, no matter how much they scrubbed down the streets.

entry.title: Date Night
entry.summary:
Author: WhatsAComicBook

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,488Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 102

Summary: "She was a metahuman in my city," said Batman, like this was something that made sense and not a completely deranged mindset for someone to have. "There are no metahumans allowed in Gotham." "What are you talking about?" cried Superman. "Gotham is an American city and you have no right to say someone isn't allowed to live here. Besides, it has a long history of metahuman protectors. Alan Scott has been here before you were even born, and Dinah used to live here too, and there's also--" Batman was annoyed. He was pretty sure No Metahumans In Gotham was canon, but he'd never actually read a comic book so he couldn't prove it. All his information came from TikToks and tumblr posts. Was it possible he'd beaten a woman to a pulp based on poorly thought-out headcanons? Luckily, he had a fallback. "I'm the richest man in Gotham and that means it's my city and I decide how it operates."
